_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Allan Bros is a third generation family owned coompany located in Naches Washington. We are deeply connected to community surronding us, so it is vital that we continue operating our business in the safest fashion possible.

We are a apple and cherrie process and storage facility. Anhydrous Ammonia is the only regulated substance associated with the building or Process we are filing for. 

The Mr4 facility is one of the four separte facilites located within the ab-1 complex. Mr-4 is a refrigerated storage only building that contains under 27,000lbs of Anhydrous Ammonia.

Employees of Allan bros are all informed on the on the dangers of ammonia and supervisors have been trained and drilled on how to treat relases of ammonia. 



The Refrigeration department does daily inspections of the entire facility. Inspections are documented and filed. Employees of the refrigeration department are required to have weekly procedure training , that is done on site. Employees are also required to attend offsite training for ammonia safety, that is put on by a certified trainer.This is all in accordance

to 29 c.f.r., 1910.1200, and WAC 296-67-025.



Within the last fifteen years, Allan Bros. has not had any accidental releases.



Emergency Response Plan

 All supervisors around the mr-4 facility and within the ab-1 complex have been, and will continue to be trained in ammonia release drills. The drills will train the supervisors on how to determine when evacution is needed and shelter in place is needed. These drills will also show all other employees what to do in the event of a release.

Allan bros also has developed a emergency action team that will consist of owners and upper manegment. Their responsiblity is to call or notify additional resources, Fire department,Yakima county lepc,epa,residents within affected, or possibly affected areas, in the event of a major release. This is all in accordance to 29 CFR 1910.38,WAC 296-67-009.



In the effort to maintain safety,Allan Br

os will procede with the following guidlines.

We will maintain clear and complete maintenance records.

Train employees that are in areas that might be affected by ammonia emergencys.

Constantly review and revise if needed written procedures.

Convey emeregency action plan to areas that are within possible affected range.
